com.isbx.locationtools.components

Class MapComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isbx.locationtools.components.MapComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback

    public class MapComponent
extends Object
implements com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback, ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks
    This class serves to simplify the process of integrating a Google Maps view into your app and the common task of initializing it to the user's location.

    Initializing a simple map operates very similarly to the standard implementation. For instance, to use a SupportMapFragment inside an Activity: 

     MapComponent mapComponent = new MapComponent(this);
 SupportMapFragment mapFragment = (SupportMapFragment) getSupportFragmentManager().findFragmentById(R.id.map);
 mapFragment.getMapAsync(mapComponent);

    To then have this map fragment be initialized to the user's current location automatically, you simply add one line after creating the MapComponent: 

     MapComponent mapComponent = new MapComponent(this);
 mapComponent.setInitToMyLocation(this);
 SupportMapFragment mapFragment = (SupportMapFragment) getSupportFragmentManager().findFragmentById(R.id.map);
 mapFragment.getMapAsync(mapComponent);

    The MapComponent will take care of connecting to the Google API Client, requesting any necessary permissions, retrieving the location, and updating the map object automatically, saving a lot of boilerplate code.

    MapComponent implements OnMapReadyCallback and in most cases should be used as the callback in your map fragments in views. If, however, your code also needs to be notified when the map object is ready, you can use your own OnMapReadyCallback, just be sure to call onMapReady(GoogleMap) from it in order for the MapComponent to behave correctly.

    Note: You must through calls to onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]) from your Activity or Fragment in order for automatic permissions checking to work on API >= 6.0.

      • setInitToMyLocation

        public void setInitToMyLocation(boolean initToMyLocation)
        Specifies whether or not this MapComponent should automatically center the map object on the user's current location when it initializes.
        Parameters:
        initToMyLocation - true if the map should center on the user's location, false otherwise

      • getMap

        public com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap getMap()
        Returns the GoogleMap that has been loaded with this MapComponent.
        Returns:
        The GoogleMap object for this component, or null if the map hasn't loaded yet

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Returns whether this component has an initialized GoogleMap associated with it.
        Returns:
        true if this component has a loaded GoogleMap, false otherwise

      • getInitialLocation

        public Location getInitialLocation()
        Returns the location that this component initialized the map with if setInitToMyLocation(boolean) is enabled.
        Returns:
        A Location object, or null if setInitToMyLocation(boolean) is disabled or the location request hasn't completed yet.

      • getLocationComponent

        public MyLocationComponent getLocationComponent()
        Returns the MyLocationComponent that this component uses internally if setInitToMyLocation(boolean) is enabled. This is helpful if you need to perform additional location operations and want to reuse the same location component for efficiency's sake.
        Returns:
        The MyLocationComponent use for the initial location request, or null if setInitToMyLocation(boolean) is disabled

      • setListener

        public void setListener(LocationCallback listener)
        Sets a LocationCallback listener to be notified when the initial user location is received by this component. This listener will never be called if setInitToMyLocation(boolean) is disabled.
        Parameters:
        listener - A LocationCallback instance
